item.title: Introduction to Threads
item.description: A process is a set of instructions that is loaded into memory to be executed by a processor or a set of processors. The process description in memory contains all necessary information, such as the Instruction Pointer (also known as the Program Counter), which indicates the next instruction to be executed, as well as registers, variables, file handles, etc., that are needed by the scheduler to execute the program.
